topic.title: Why people here want to post anonymously?
topic.body: I'm wondering why people who come to these private networks want full anonymity if they are not talking about stuff like porn, drugs etc. Why can't they just post with their name? Just trying to understand what are their motives

1560623363_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: Great article. Thanks for sharing. You should consider to post your articles on decentium.org and receive tips in EOS

1560426998_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: You might be interested in upcoming Voice.com social network created by Block.one the company behind EOSIO. You'll get rewarded for your posts, for liking and commenting and you will be able to use these rewards to upvote your articles. There'll be KYC but they're going to do also anonymous accounts. By the way why do you want to be anonymous

1554492696_1GQMHdkj67rAzy1uMbq5Smvhg9o4Y.body: How would you censor the illegal stuff?

1561288542_14hmCEXpoVdYQqeve93LpieDx2k8a.body:
Why don't I? Because I think that complete privacy gives people the possibility to share their ideas without being attacked for who they are or how they look like. It gives freedom from labels. 
My question is not an attack on people posting anonymously rather than pure curiosity about their motives behind it
oh not at all. we should be able to speak our mind without the need of hiding however if we still want to have our identity hidden we should be allowed.

> [whitewolf](#comment_10_1APZQJTjc6VivR8kW2YDfaPUFkx8vy43o8): This is well past theory, my dude. Here is a couple of articles and way more on the web if you think this is just a "theory". [...]

This is really worrying. We need more crypto adoption so people can crowdfund directly with their accounts
